headline: Western Digital Exit Leaves Sandisk Independent With Valuation Gap And Volatility
summary: Western Digital has completed a US$3.17b secondary public offering, fully exiting its ownership stake in Sandisk. The deal involved only existing shares, so Sandisk did not issue new stock or receive cash proceeds. The transaction marks a clean break between Sandisk and its former parent, changing the shareholder mix for NasdaqGS:SNDK. For you as an investor, the key point is that Sandisk now stands on its own, with Western Digital no longer in the background as a major shareholder. Sandisk...

headline: Western Digital Dumps Sandisk Stock. What’s Behind the Move.
summary: Sandisk  was falling early on Wednesday as its former parent  Western Digital  plans to sell shares in the flash memory company.  It shouldn’t be a concern for Sandisk shareholders.  Western Digital is offering about 5.8 million Sandisk shares at $545 each, with a total value of around $3.17 billion, Sandisk said in a release.

headline: Western Digital Sells Sandisk Stake To Cut Debt And Fund AI Storage
summary: Western Digital has launched a multibillion dollar secondary offering of its Sandisk stake. The sale is intended to fully monetize its spin off position in Sandisk and reduce debt. The transaction is framed as part of Western Digital's broader capital allocation and balance sheet plan. Western Digital, trading on NasdaqGS:WDC, is drawing fresh attention as it moves to cash out of Sandisk after spinning the business off. The company is pairing this secondary sale with its ongoing focus on...

headline: Western Digital Sold Out All 2026 Hard Drive Production as AI Centers Scramble
summary: Western Digital (NASDAQ:WDC) shares have surged 65% year-to-date as the company transformed from an overlooked storage provider into an AI infrastructure powerhouse. The stock has grown significantly as investors recognized the company’s pivot from consumer storage to AI infrastructure, reflecting a complete business reinvention driven by insatiable demand from hyperscale data centers. Retail investors on ... Western Digital Sold Out All 2026 Hard Drive Production as AI Centers Scramble

headline: Western Digital to sell partial Sandisk stake for $3.17 billion to cut debt
summary: Hard disk drive maker Western Digital plans to raise $3.17 ‌billion by selling some of ‌its stake in former unit Sandisk through a ​secondary share sale at a 7.7% discount to its last close, the flash drive maker said on Wednesday.  Western Digital is ‌expected to ⁠swap the 5.8 million shares up for sale with debt held ⁠by affiliates of J.P. Morgan and BofA Securities.  The sale will ​leave Western Digital ​with a stake ​of nearly $1 billion, according ‌to Reuters calculations, which the ​company intends ​to dispose of eventually.

raw.headline: Western Digital to sell partial Sandisk stake for $3.17 billion to cut debt
raw.summary: Hard disk drive maker Western Digital plans to raise $3.17 ‌billion by selling some of ‌its stake in former unit Sandisk through a ​secondary share sale at a 7.7% discount to its last close, the flash drive maker said on Wednesday.  Western Digital is ‌expected to ⁠swap the 5.8 million shares up for sale with debt held ⁠by affiliates of J.P. Morgan and BofA Securities.  The sale will ​leave Western Digital ​with a stake ​of nearly $1 billion, according ‌to Reuters calculations, which the ​company intends ​to dispose of eventually.

headline: Sandisk Announces Pricing of Secondary Offering of Common Stock
summary: MILPITAS, Calif., February 18, 2026--Sandisk Corporation (Nasdaq: SNDK) (the "Company" or "Sandisk") announced today the pricing of a secondary public offering (the "Offering") of 5,821,135 shares of its common stock (the "SNDK Shares") currently owned by Western Digital Corporation, the Company’s former parent ("WDC"). The SNDK Shares will be offered at a public offering price of $545.00 per share. Sandisk is not selling any shares of common stock and will not receive any proceeds from the sale

raw.headline: Sandisk Announces Pricing of Secondary Offering of Common Stock
raw.summary: MILPITAS, Calif., February 18, 2026--Sandisk Corporation (Nasdaq: SNDK) (the "Company" or "Sandisk") announced today the pricing of a secondary public offering (the "Offering") of 5,821,135 shares of its common stock (the "SNDK Shares") currently owned by Western Digital Corporation, the Company’s former parent ("WDC"). The SNDK Shares will be offered at a public offering price of $545.00 per share. Sandisk is not selling any shares of common stock and will not receive any proceeds from the sale
